Articles.Content:
So the other day i realized ksp has sort of started to brained washed me. Ive been absentminded as a kerbal. Ill get up to do something and forget what it was and start thinking about ksp. Also I've been doing thing in the wrong order. Its also making new habits. Ive been playing Gta v and x-plane and when take of immediately search for the sas button while its not there. Also everything i think of eventually involves space. Its driving me crazy!!!!!! Like this :huh::sticktongue::huh::sticktongue::sealed:

Any help on how to solve this?

Just roll with it and accept your fate, man!

Edited November 6, 2013 by Akinesis
I put a SAS button on the dashboard of my car. Doesn't do anything, but it doesn't feel right when it isn't there.

You are infected with the Kerbal virus, you should immediately contact a doctor.

Symptons:

Crazyness

Stupidity

SRBs

This virus will drastically change your life.
/Solve/ this? Be glad you are like that!
I think the only way to solve this is becoming Chris Hadfield.

You my fellow Kerbonaut are clearly a victim of the well known Tetris effect!

It can strike you with almost any game or often repeated activity and has the effect of you visualizing things or activities from the game in the real world.

It happens to a lot of people and is no reason for concern.

Fly save on all your future adventures!

PS: This is a real thing! Wikipedia link --> Tetris effect

The best thing is always to find someone like minded so you can bang on about whatever your current pet is at great exhaustive length. This forum is the right place to be, you are already recieving the help you need.
you play x-pane!!!! start that if you really want to stop. (not that you would!)

I myself have change my life plans because of KSP. I used to just want a degree in astrophysics. Now I want a degree in rocket science as well.

Thanks, ksp.

Edited November 7, 2013 by spink00
As well

Every time I see a space game (like Star Citizen), I ask how the ships maneuver because there's no visible engine gimbal, thrust vectoring or RCS blocks. I end up disappointed not seeing all that in action; Nexus: The Jupiter Incident did an awesome job showing that. =P

KSP has made me want to be an astronaut.

Luckily I still haven't done my degrees yet, so I might do it!

(Only 5 A levels, 2 bachelor degrees, a PhD to go!)

I put a SAS button on the dashboard of my car. Doesn't do anything, but it doesn't feel right when it isn't there.

The SAS can help flip your car back on it's wheels in case it rolls over
I agree. I haven't been this ridiculously into a game in a long time....Like years. My friend asked me a few days ago "How do you win?" and I just stared at him.

You can never go back

You are now one of us
Ive looked up at the moon and thought to myself "When did the mun change?"

Every time I see a space game (like Star Citizen), I ask how the ships maneuver because there's no visible engine gimbal, thrust vectoring or RCS blocks. I end up disappointed not seeing all that in action; Nexus: The Jupiter Incident did an awesome job showing that. =P

Star citizen has engine gimbal and manuvering thrusters
